class psef.models.lti_provider.UserLTIProvider(user, lti_provider, lti_user_id)[source]¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Model, cg_sqlalchemy_helpers.mixins.TimestampMixin

This class connects a user_models.User to a

LTIProviderBase.

This class makes sure that it is possible to have two users with the same lti user id, but from different LMSes. Each user can be linked to at most one LTIProvider, and eacher lti_user_id has to be unique within the LMS.

classmethod get_or_create_user(lti_user_id: str, lti_provider: LTI1p1Provider, wanted_username: t.Optional[str], full_name: str, email: str) → t.Tuple[‘user_models.User’, t.Optional[str]][source]¶
classmethod get_or_create_user(lti_user_id: str, lti_provider: LTI1p3Provider, wanted_username: t.Optional[str], full_name: str, email: str, *, old_lti_user_id: t.Optional[str]) → t.Tuple[‘user_models.User’, t.Optional[str]]

Get or create a new user for the given LTI Provider

Parameters

  • lti_user_id (str) – The user id that we received from the LMS.

  • lti_provider (LTIProviderBase) – The provider of the lauchn.

  • wanted_username (Optional[str]) – The username the user wants if it is created.

  • full_name (str) – The full name of the launching user.

  • email (str) – The email of the user that does this launch.

Return type

tuple[User, Optional[str]]

Returns

A tuple containing, in this order: the found or created user, optionally an access token to login the new user (this is only returned if the current user is not the resulting user).

lti_user_id¶

The id of the user given to us by the LMS. Not globally unique!

psef.models.permission¶

This module defines a Permission.

SPDX-License-Identifier: AGPL-3.0-only

class psef.models.permission.Permission(*args, **kwds)[source]¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Model, typing.Generic

This class defines database permissions.

A permission can be a global- or a course- permission. Global permissions describe the ability to do something general, e.g. create a course or the usage of snippets. These permissions are connected to a Role which is hold be a User. Similarly course permissions are bound to a CourseRole. These roles are assigned to users only in the context of a single Course. Thus a user can hold different permissions in different courses.

Warning

Think twice about using this class directly! You probably want a non database permission (see permissions.py) which are type checked and WAY faster. If you need to check if a user has a certain permission use the User.has_permission() of, even better, psef.auth.ensure_permission() functions.

Variables

  • default_value – The default value for this permission.

  • course_permission – Indicates if this permission is for course specific actions. If this is the case a user can have this permission for a subset of all the courses. If course_permission is False this permission is global for the entire site.

classmethod get_all_permissions(perm_type: Type[_T]) → Sequence[psef.models.permission.Permission[_T]][source]¶

Get all database permissions of a certain type.

Parameters

perm_type (type[_T]) – The type of permission to get.

Return type

Sequence[Permission[_T]]

Returns

A list of all database permissions of the given type.

classmethod get_all_permissions_from_list(perms: Sequence[_T]) → Sequence[psef.models.permission.Permission[_T]][source]¶

Get database permissions corresponding to a list of permissions.

Parameters

perms (Sequence[_T]) – The permissions to get the database permission of.

Return type

Sequence[Permission[_T]]

Returns

A list of all requested database permission.

classmethod get_name_column() → cg_sqlalchemy_helpers.types.DbColumn[str][source]¶

Get the name column in the database for the permissions.

Return type

DbColumn[str]

Returns

The name column of permissions.

The correct database permission.

The permission of this database permission.

psef.models.plagiarism¶

This module defines a PlagiarismCase.

SPDX-License-Identifier: AGPL-3.0-only

class psef.models.plagiarism.PlagiarismCase(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Model

Describe a case of possible plagiarism.

Variables

  • work1_id – The id of the first work to be associated with this possible case of plagiarism.

  • work2_id – The id of the second work to be associated with this possible case of plagiarism.

  • created_at – When was this case created.

  • plagiarism_run_id – The PlagiarismRun in which this case was discovered.

  • match_avg – The average similarity between the two matches. What the value exactly means differs per provider.

  • match_max – The maximum similarity between the two matches. What the value exactly means differs per provider.

property any_work_deleted¶

Is any of the works connected to this case deleted.

Return type

bool

class psef.models.plagiarism.PlagiarismMatch(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Model

Describes a possible plagiarism match between two files.

Variables

  • file1_id – The id of the first file associated with this match.

  • file1_start – The start position of the first file associated with this match. This position can be (and probably is) a line but it could also be a byte offset.

  • file1_end – The end position of the first file associated with this match. This position can be (and probably is) a line but it could also be a byte offset.

  • file2_id – Same as file1_id but of the second file.

  • file2_start – Same as file1_start but for the second file.

  • file2_end – Same as file1_end but for the second file.

class psef.models.plagiarism.PlagiarismRun(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Model

Describes a run for a plagiarism provider.

Variables

  • state – The state this run is in.

  • log – The log on stdout and stderr we got from running the plagiarism provider. This is only available if the state is done or crashed.

  • json_config – The config used for this run saved in a sorted association list.

  • assignment_id – The id of the assignment this belongs to.

property plagiarism_cls¶

Get the class of the plagiarism provider of this run.

Return type

type[PlagiarismProvider]

Returns

The class of this plagiarism provider run.

property provider_name¶

The provider name of this plagiarism run.

Type

returns

Return type

str

Bases: enum.IntEnum

Describes in what state a PlagiarismRun is.

Parameters

  • running – The provider is currently running.

  • done – The provider has finished without crashing.

  • crashed – The provider has crashed in some way.

static get_default_course_roles() → Mapping[str, MutableMapping[psef.permissions.CoursePermission, psef.models.permission.Permission[psef.permissions.CoursePermission]]][source]¶

Get all default course roles as specified in the config and their permissions (Permission).

{
    'student': {
        'can_edit_assignment_info': <Permission-object>,
        'can_submit_own_work': <Permission-object>
    }
}
Return type

Mapping[str, MutableMapping[CoursePermission, Permission[CoursePermission]]]

Returns

A name dict mapping where the name is the name of the course-role and the dict is name permission mapping between the name of a permission and the permission object. See above for an example.

classmethod get_initial_course_role(course: psef.models.course.Course) → psef.models.role.CourseRole[source]¶

Get the initial course role for a given course.

class psef.models.rubric.RubricRowBase(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: psef.helpers.NotEqualMixin, sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Model

Describes a row of some rubric.

This class forms the link between Assignment and RubricItem and holds information about the row.

Variables

assignment_id – The assignment id of the assignment that belows to this rubric row.

classmethod create_from_json(header: str, description: str, items: List[psef.models.rubric.RubricItem.JSONBaseSerialization]) → psef.models.rubric.RubricRowBase[source]¶

Create a new rubric row for an assignment.

Parameters

  • header (str) – The name of the new rubric row.

  • description (str) – The description of the new rubric row.

  • items (list[JSONBaseSerialization]) – The items that should be added to this row. The format is the same as the items passed to RubricRowBase.update_items_from_json().

Return type

RubricRowBase

Returns

The newly created row.

is_selected(self) → bool[source]¶

Is this rubric row selected at least once.

Return type

bool

property is_valid¶

Check if the current row is valid.

Return type

bool

Returns

False if the row has no items or if the max points of the items is not > 0.

property locked¶

Is this rubric row locked.

If it is locked the reason is returned.

Return type

make_work_rubric_item(self, work: psef.models.work.Work, item_id: Union[int, psef.models.rubric.RubricItem], multiplier: float) → psef.models.rubric.WorkRubricItem[source]¶

Make a WorkRubricItem for a manual grade.

Parameters

  • work (Work) – The work to create the WorkRubricItem for.

  • item_id (Union[int, RubricItem]) – The item where the WorkRubricItem should be connected to.

  • multiplier (float) – The multiplier to use, this should always be 1.0 for a normal rubric row.

Return type

WorkRubricItem

make_work_rubric_item_for_auto_test(self, work: work_models.Work, percentage: float, grade_calculator: auto_test_models.GradeCalculator) → psef.models.rubric.WorkRubricItem[source]¶

Create a WorkRubricItem for an AutoTest.

Parameters

  • work – The work to create the WorkRubricItem for.

  • percentage – The percentage achieved in the AT category.

  • grade_calculator – The grade calculator to use, this is not used by continuous rubric rows.

update_from_json(self, header: str, description: str, items: List[psef.models.rubric.RubricItem.JSONBaseSerialization]) → None[source]¶

Update this rubric in place.

Warning

All items not present in the given items list will be deleted from the rubric row.

Parameters

  • header (str) – The new header of the row.

  • description (str) – The new description of the row.

  • items (list[JSONBaseSerialization]) – The items that should be in this row (see warning). The format is the same as the items passed to RubricRowBase.update_items_from_json().

Return type

None

Returns

Nothing.

update_items_from_json(self, items: List[psef.models.rubric.RubricItem.JSONBaseSerialization]) → None[source]¶

Update the items of this row in place.

Warning

All items not present in the given items list will be deleted from the rubric row.

Parameters

items (list[JSONBaseSerialization]) – The items (RubricItem) that should be added or updated. If id is in an item it should be an int and the rubric item with the corresponding id will be updated instead of added.

Return type

None

Returns

Nothing.

psef.models.user¶

This module defines a User.

SPDX-License-Identifier: AGPL-3.0-only

class psef.models.user.User(name, email, password, username, active=True, virtual=False, role=None, is_test_student=False, courses=None)[source]¶

Bases: psef.helpers.NotEqualMixin, sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Model

This class describes a user of the system.

>>> u1 = User('', '', '', '')
>>> u1.id = 5
>>> u1.id
5
>>> u1.id = 6
Traceback (most recent call last):
...
AssertionError
Variables

  • lti_user_id – The id of this user in a LTI consumer.

  • name – The name of this user.

  • role_id – The id of the role this user has.

  • courses – A mapping between course_id and course-role for all courses this user is currently enrolled.

  • email – The e-mail of this user.

  • virtual – Is this user an actual user of the site, or is it a virtual user.

  • password – The password of this user, it is automatically hashed.

  • assignment_results – The way this user can do LTI grade passback.

  • assignments_assigned – A mapping between assignment_ids and AssignmentAssignedGrader objects.

  • reset_email_on_lti – Determines if the email should be reset on the next LTI launch.

property can_see_hidden¶

Can the user see hidden assignments.

Return type

bool

contains_user(self, possible_member: psef.models.user.User) → bool[source]¶

Check if given user is part of this user.

A user A is part of a user B if either A == B or B.is_group and B.group.has_as_member(A)

Parameters

possible_member (User) – The user to check for if it is part of self.

Return type

bool

Returns

A bool indicating if self contains possible_member.

Return type

User

Returns

A newly created test student user named ‘TEST_STUDENT’ followed by a random string.

Enroll this user in a course with the given course_role.

Parameters

course_role (CourseRole) – The role the user should get in the new course. This object already contains the information about the course, so the user will be enrolled in the course connected to this role.

Return type

None

Returns

Nothing.

Raises

AssertionError – If the user is already enrolled in the course.

classmethod find_possible_username(wanted_username: str) → str[source]¶

Find a possible username for a new user starting with wanted_username.

Parameters

wanted_username (str) – The username the new user should have in the ideal case. If not available we will try to find a username looking like $wanted_username ($number).

Return type

str

Returns

A username that looks like wanted_username that is still available.

get_all_permissions() → t.Mapping[GlobalPermission, bool][source]¶
get_all_permissions(course_id: t.Union[‘course_models.Course’, int]) → t.Mapping[CoursePermission, bool]
Get all global permissions (Permission) of this user or

all course permissions of the user in a specific course_models.Course.

Parameters

course_id (Union[Course, int, None]) – The course or course id

Return type

Union[Mapping[CoursePermission, bool], Mapping[GlobalPermission, bool]]

Returns

A name boolean mapping where the name is the name of the permission and the value indicates if this user has this permission.

get_all_permissions_in_courses(self) → Mapping[int, Mapping[psef.permissions.CoursePermission, bool]][source]¶

Get all permissions for all courses the current user is enrolled in

Return type

Mapping[int, Mapping[CoursePermission, bool]]

Returns

A mapping from course id to a mapping from CoursePermission to a boolean indicating if the current user has this permission.

get_contained_users(self) → Sequence[psef.models.user.User][source]¶

Get all contained users of this user.

Return type

Sequence[User]

Returns

If this user is the virtual user of this group a list of members of the group, otherwise the user itself is wrapped in a list and returned.

get_permissions_in_courses(self, wanted_perms: Sequence[psef.permissions.CoursePermission]) → Mapping[int, Mapping[psef.permissions.CoursePermission, bool]][source]¶

Check for specific Permission`s in all courses (:class:.course_models.Course`) the user is enrolled in.

Please note that passing an empty perms object is supported. However the resulting mapping will be empty.

>>> User('', '', '', '').get_permissions_in_courses([])
{}
Parameters

wanted_perms (Sequence[CoursePermission]) – The permissions names to check for.

Return type

Mapping[int, Mapping[CoursePermission, bool]]

Returns

A mapping where the first keys indicate the course id, the values at this are a mapping between the given permission names and a boolean indicating if the current user has this permission for the course with this course id.

get_readable_name(self) → str[source]¶

Get the readable name of this user.

Return type

str

Returns

If this is a normal user this method simply returns the name of the user. If this user is the virtual user of a group a nicely formatted group name is returned.

get_reset_token(self) → str[source]¶

Get a token which a user can use to reset his password.

Return type

str

Returns

A token that can be used in User.reset_password() to reset the password of a user.

has_permission(permission: CoursePermission, course_id: t.Union[int, ‘course_models.Course’]) → bool[source]¶
has_permission(permission: GlobalPermission) → bool
Check whether this user has the specified global or course

Permission.

To check a course permission the course_id has to be set.

Parameters

  • permission (Union[GlobalPermission, CoursePermission]) – The permission or permission name

  • course_id (Union[Course, int, None]) – The course or course id

Return type

bool

Returns

Whether the role has the permission or not

Raises

KeyError – If the permission parameter is a string and no permission with this name exists.

id¶

The id of the user

property is_active¶

Is the current user an active user.

Remove this property

Return type

bool

Returns

If the user is active.

is_enrolled(self, course: Union[int, course_models.Course]) → bool[source]¶

Check if a user is enrolled in the given course.

Parameters

course (Union[int, Course]) – The course to in which the user might be enrolled. This can also be a course id for efficiency purposes (so you don’t have to load the entire course object).

Return type

bool

Returns

If the user is enrolled in the given course. This is always False if this user is virtual.

Is this the global administrator of the site.

This can only ever be True for users flushed to the database.

bool

classmethod register_new_user(*, username: str, password: str, email: str, name: str) → psef.models.user.User[source]¶

Register a new user with the given data.

Parameters

  • username (str) – The username of the new user, if a user already exists with this username an APIException is raised.

  • password (str) – The password of the new user, if the password is not strong enough an APIException is raised.

  • email (str) – The email of the new user, if not valid an APIException is raised.

Name

The name of the new user.

Return type

User

Returns

The created user, already added (but not committed) to the database.

reset_password(self, token: str, new_password: str) → None[source]¶

Reset a users password by using a token.

Note

Don’t forget to commit the database.

Parameters

  • token (str) – A token as generated by User.get_reset_token().

  • new_password (str) – The new password to set.

Return type

None

Returns

Nothing.

Raises

PermissionException – If something was wrong with the given token.

classmethod resolve(possible_user: Union[User, werkzeug.local.LocalProxy]) → psef.models.user.User[source]¶

Unwrap the possible local proxy to a user.

Parameters

possible_user (Union[User, LocalProxy]) – The user we should unwrap.

Return type

User

Returns

If the given argument was a LocalProxy _get_current_object() is called and the return value is returned, otherwise the given argument is returned.

Raises

AssertionError – If the given argument was not a user after unwrapping.

username¶

The username of the user

class psef.models.work.GradeHistory(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Model

This object is a item in a grade history of a Work.

Variables

  • changed_at – When was this grade added.

  • is_rubric – Was this grade added as a result of a rubric.

  • passed_back – Was this grade passed back to the LMS through LTI.

  • work – What work does this grade belong to.

  • user – What user added this grade.

class psef.models.work.Work(**kwargs)[source]¶

This object describes a single work or submission of a user_models.User for an assignment_models.Assignment.

Add the given tree to as only files to the current work.

All previous files will be unlinked from this assignment.

Parameters

None

classmethod create_from_tree(assignment: psef.models.assignment.Assignment, author: psef.models.user.User, tree: psef.extract_tree.ExtractFileTree, *, created_at: Optional[cg_dt_utils.DatetimeWithTimezone] = None) → psef.models.work.Work[source]¶

Create a submission from a file tree.

Warning

This function does not check if the author has permission to create a submission, so this is the responsibility of the caller!

Parameters

  • assignment (Assignment) – The assignment in which the submission should be created.

  • author (User) – The author of the submission.

  • tree (ExtractFileTree) – The tree that are the files of the submission.

  • created_at (Optional[DatetimeWithTimezone]) – At what time was this submission created, defaults to the current time.

Return type

Work

Returns

The created work.

str

The name of the zip file in the MIRROR_UPLOADS dir.

deleted¶

Get a query that checks if this submission is deleted.

divide_new_work(self) → None[source]¶

Divide a freshly created work.

First we check if an old work of the same author exists, that case the same grader is assigned. Otherwise we take the grader that misses the most of work.

Return type

None

Returns

Nothing

get_all_authors(self) → List[psef.models.user.User][source]¶

Get all the authors of this submission.

Return type

list[User]

Returns

A list of users that were the authors of this submission.

get_file_children_mapping(self, exclude: psef.models.file.FileOwner) → Mapping[Optional[int], Sequence[psef.models.file.File]][source]¶

Get a mapping that maps a file id to all its children.

This implementation does a single query to the database and runs in O(n*log(n)), so it will be quite a bit quicker than using the children attribute on files if you are going to need all children or all files.

The list of children is sorted on filename.

Parameters

exclude (FileOwner) – The file owners to exclude

Return type

Mapping[Optional[int], Sequence[File]]

Returns

A mapping from file id to list of all its children for this submission.

get_linter_feedback(self) → Iterable[str][source]¶

Return type

Iterable[str]

Returns

An iterator that produces the all feedback given on this work by linters.

classmethod get_rubric_grade_per_work(assignment: psef.models.assignment.Assignment) → cg_sqlalchemy_helpers.types.MyQuery[Tuple[int, float]][source]¶

Get the rubric grades of submissions for the given assignment.

Warning

The returned grade might not the final grade for the submission, as the grade might be overridden.

Parameters

assignment (Assignment) – The assignment in which you want to get the rubric grades.

Return type

MyQuery[tuple[int, float]]

Returns

A query that returns tuples (work_id, rubric_grade) for each submission in the given assignment that has at least one selected rubric item.

run_linter(self) → None[source]¶

Run all linters for the assignment on this work.

All linters that have been used on the assignment will also run on this work.

If the linters feature is disabled this function will simply return and not do anything.

The found file.

select_rubric_items(self, items: List[WorkRubricItem], user: psef.models.user.User, override: bool = False) → None[source]¶

Selects the given RubricItem.

Note

This also passes back the grade to LTI if this is necessary.

Note

This also sets the actual grade field to None.

Warning

You should do all input sanitation before calling this function. Like checking for duplicate items and correct assignment.

Parameters

  • item – The item to add.

  • user (User) – The user selecting the item.

Return type

None

Returns

Nothing

property selected_rubric_points¶

The amount of points that are currently selected in the rubric for this work.

float

set_grade(new_grade: t.Optional[float], user: ‘user_models.User’, grade_origin: Literal[GradeOrigin.human] = 'GradeOrigin.human') → GradeHistory[source]¶
set_grade(*, grade_origin: GradeOrigin) → GradeHistory

Set the grade to the new grade.

Note

This also passes back the grade to LTI if this is necessary (see passback_grade()).

Note

If grade_origin is human the user is required.

Parameters

  • new_grade (Union[float, None, MissingType]) – The new grade to set

  • user (Optional[User]) – The user setting the new grade.

  • grade_origin (GradeOrigin) – The way this grade was given.

  • never_passback – Never passback the new grade.

Return type

GradeHistory

Returns

Nothing

classmethod user_submissions_filter(user: psef.models.user.User) → Union[cg_sqlalchemy_helpers.types.DbColumn[bool], cg_sqlalchemy_helpers.types.DbColumn[typing_extensions.Literal[True]], cg_sqlalchemy_helpers.types.DbColumn[typing_extensions.Literal[False]], cg_sqlalchemy_helpers.types.ExistsColumn][source]¶

class psef.models.work.WorkOrigin(value)[source]¶

Bases: enum.Enum

What is the way the work was handed in.

psef.models.auto_test¶

This module defines all models needed for auto tests.

SPDX-License-Identifier: AGPL-3.0-only

class psef.models.auto_test.AutoTest(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Model, cg_sqlalchemy_helpers.mixins.TimestampMixin, cg_sqlalchemy_helpers.mixins.IdMixin

This class represents a auto test.

A group set is a single wrapper over all groups. Every group is part of a group set. The group set itself is connected to a single course and zero or more assignments in this course.

Variables

  • minimum_size – The minimum size of that group should have before it can be used to submit a submission.

  • maximum_size – The maximum amount of members a group can ever have.

static add_to_run(work: psef.models.work.Work) → bool[source]¶

Add the given work to the continuous feedback run.

This function only does something if there is an continuous feedback run.

Parameters

work (Work) – The work to add to the continuous feedback run.

Return type

bool

Returns

True if the work was added to the continuous feedback run.

Warning

This function changes the session if it returns True, so a commit is necessary in that case.

property all_suites¶

Get all the suites from this AutoTest as an iterator.

Return type

Iterator[AutoTestSuite]

copy(self, rubric_mapping: Mapping[psef.models.RubricRow, psef.models.RubricRow]) → psef.models.auto_test.AutoTest[source]¶

Copy this AutoTest configuration.

Parameters

rubric_mapping (Mapping[RubricRowBase, RubricRowBase]) – The mapping how the rubric was copied, if suite A was copied to suite B then suite B is connected to rubric row rubric_mapping[A.rubric_row].

Return type

AutoTest

Returns

The copied AutoTest config.

Note

The caller still needs to connect the copied config to an assignment.

ensure_no_runs(self) → None[source]¶

Raises

Return type

None

Optional[Callable[[Sequence[RubricItem], float], RubricItem]]

If there is not result for the given result, a result is created.

Parameters

None

Returns

property run¶

The final run of this AutoTest.

Return type

Optional[AutoTestRun]

Returns

The final run of this AutoTest or None if there is none.

start_test_run(self) → psef.models.auto_test.AutoTestRun[source]¶

Start this AutoTest run.

This function checks if the AutoTest is in a state where a run can be started, and if this is the case it starts the run. It also schedules a task to notify our broker that we need a runner. The changes to the database are not committed!

Return type

AutoTestRun

class psef.models.auto_test.AutoTestResult(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Model, cg_sqlalchemy_helpers.mixins.TimestampMixin, cg_sqlalchemy_helpers.mixins.IdMixin, psef.helpers.NotEqualMixin

classmethod get_results_by_user(student_id: int) → cg_sqlalchemy_helpers.types.MyQuery[psef.models.auto_test.AutoTestResult][source]¶

Get the AutoTestResult s for the given student.

Return type

MyQuery[AutoTestResult]

Returns

A query that gets all results by the given user. Notice that these results are for all AutoTestRun s.

is_finished¶

Has this state passed?

state¶

Get the state of this result

>>> from datetime import datetime, timezone
>>> called = False
>>> def fun(_):
...  global called
...  called = True
>>> psef.tasks.adjust_amount_runners = fun
>>> r = AutoTestResult(run=AutoTestRun())
>>> not_set = object()
>>> r.started_at = not_set
>>> r.state = auto_test_step_models.AutoTestStepResultState.running
>>> isinstance(r.started_at, datetime)
True
>>> r.started_at.tzinfo == timezone.utc
True
>>> called
True
>>> r.state = 6
>>> r.started_at is None
True
>>> r.started_at = not_set
>>> r.state = 6
>>> r.started_at is not_set
True
update_rubric(self) → None[source]¶

This might pass back the grade to the LMS if required.

Return type

None

class psef.models.auto_test.AutoTestRun(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Model, cg_sqlalchemy_helpers.mixins.TimestampMixin, cg_sqlalchemy_helpers.mixins.IdMixin

This class represents a single run of an AutoTest configuration.

At the moment each AutoTest will always only have one AutoTestRun.

add_active_runner(self, runner_ipaddr: str) → psef.models.auto_test.AutoTestRunner[source]¶

Start this run.

This means setting the started_date, creating a runner object for this run, and scheduling some tasks that will kill the runner after some period of time.

Note

To start an entire run you should use AutoTest.start_run().

Parameters

runner_ipaddr (str) – The ip address of the runner that will perform this run. This is used for authentication purposes.

Return type

AutoTestRunner

classmethod get_runs_that_need_runners() → List[psef.models.auto_test.AutoTestRun][source]¶

Get all runs that need more runners.

This function gets all runs that have fewer runners than they should, which is calculated using the amount of results that have not yet started.

Return type

list[AutoTestRun]

increment_job_id(self) → None[source]¶

Increment the job id of this runner.

This should be done when creating a new runner for this run, so we can track each runner by this id. This is different from creating a completely new job id, as this will make sure we keep the same base job id.

Return type

None

A single run might have multiple runners, as a runner might crash and in this case it is replaced by a new runner.

psef.models.auto_test_step¶

This module defines all models needed for a step of an AutoTest.

This module also contains the code needed to execute each step.

SPDX-License-Identifier: AGPL-3.0-only

class psef.models.auto_test_step.AutoTestStepBase(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Model, cg_sqlalchemy_helpers.mixins.TimestampMixin, cg_sqlalchemy_helpers.mixins.IdMixin

The base class that every step inherits.

This class provides represents a single step, and contains the code needed to execute it.

property command_time_limit¶

Get the command time limit for this step.

Return type

float

property data¶

Get the data for this step.

Return type

Union[dict[str, Union[str, int, float, bool, None, dict[str, Any], list[Any]]], list[Union[str, int, float, bool, None, dict[str, Any], list[Any]]], str, int, float, bool, None, dict[str, Any], list[Any]]

classmethod execute_step(container: auto_test_module.StartedContainer, opts: auto_test_module.ExecuteOptions) → float[source]¶

Execute this step.

Danger

You should only do this on a test server. This function also checks this, but it is important to be sure from the calling code too as this function will execute user provided (untrusted) code.

Parameters

  • container – The container to execute the code in.

  • opts – The execute options for executing this step.

Returns

The amount of points achieved in this step.

get_amount_achieved_points(self, result: psef.models.auto_test_step.AutoTestStepResult) → float[source]¶

Return type

>>> AutoTestStepBase.remove_step_details(object())
{}
>>> AutoTestStepBase.remove_step_details({'secret': 'key'})
{}

update_data_from_json(self, json: Dict[str, psef.helpers.JSONType]) → None[source]¶
>>> t = AutoTestStepBase()
>>> t.validate_data = lambda _: print('CALLED!')
>>> d = object()
>>> t.update_data_from_json(d)
CALLED!
>>> t.data is d
True

None

psef.models.task_result¶

This file contains all models needed for task results.

class psef.models.task_result.TaskResult(user)[source]¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Model, cg_sqlalchemy_helpers.mixins.UUIDMixin, cg_sqlalchemy_helpers.mixins.TimestampMixin

This class represents the state and result of a celery task.

Variables

  • result – The result the task produced, or more importantly the exception that was raised during the task.

  • user – The user that initiated the task.

as_task(self, fun: Callable[[], None]) → None[source]¶

Run the given fun as the task.

Warning

One of the first things this function do is committing the current session, however after running fun nothing is committed.

Parameters

fun (Callable[[], None]) – The function to run as the task, catching the exceptions it produces and storing them in this task result.

Return type

None

Returns

Nothing.

class psef.models.task_result.TaskResultJSON(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: dict

The serialization scheme for a TaskResult.

class psef.models.task_result.TaskResultState(value)[source]¶

Bases: enum.Enum

The state of a task result.

Variables

  • not_started – The task has not been started yet.

  • started – The task has started but has not finished.

  • finished – The task finished successfully.

  • failed – The task failed in a way we know this task can fail.

  • crashed – The task crashed, i.e. it failed in an unexpected way.

SPDX-License-Identifier: AGPL-3.0-only

psef.parsers¶

This module implements parsers that raise a APIException when they fail.

SPDX-License-Identifier: AGPL-3.0-only

psef.parsers.parse_datetime(to_parse: object) → DatetimeWithTimezone[source]¶
psef.parsers.parse_datetime(to_parse: object, allow_none: bool) → t.Optional[DatetimeWithTimezone]

Parse a datetime string using dateutil.

Parameters

  • to_parse (object) – The object to parse, if this is not a string the parsing will always fail.

  • allow_none (bool) – Allow None to be passed without raising a exception. if to_parse is None and this option is True the result will be None.

Return type

Optional[DatetimeWithTimezone]

Returns

The parsed DatetimeWithTimezone object.

Raises

APIException – If the parsing fails for whatever reason.

psef.parsers.parse_email_list(to_parse: object, allow_none: bool = False) → Optional[List[Tuple[str, str]]][source]¶

Parse email list into a list of emails.

This list should be in the form of a address-list as specified in RFC2822.

Parameters

  • to_parse (object) – The object to parse, it should be a str if you want it to succeed.

  • allow_none (bool) – If True we will not error if to_parse is None.

Return type

Optional[list[tuple[str, str]]]

Returns

A list of addresses or None if to_parse is None and allow_none is True.

Raises

APIException – If the parsing fails in some way.

psef.parsers.parse_enum(to_parse: object, parse_into_enum: Type[T], allow_none: bool = False, option_name: Optional[str] = None) → Optional[T][source]¶

Parse the given string to the given parse_into_enum.

Parameters

  • to_parse (object) – The object to parse. If this value is not a string or None the function will always return a type error.

  • parse_into_enum (type[T]) – The enum to parse to.

  • allow_none (bool) – Allow None to be passed and return None if this is the case. If this value is False and None is passed the function will raise a APIException.

  • option_name (Optional[str]) – The name of the option, only used in error display.

Return type

Optional[T]

Returns

A instance of the given enum.

Raises

APIException – If the parsing fails in some way.

psef.parsers.try_parse_email_list(to_parse: object, allow_none: bool = False) → Optional[str][source]¶

Try parsing an email list.

This function is basically the same as parse_email_list() but this function returns to_parse stripped of unnecessary whitespaces if the parsing succeeded.

Parameters

  • to_parse (object) – See parse_email_list() for what it does.

  • allow_none (bool) – See parse_email_list() for what it does.

Return type

Optional[str]

Returns

Its input stripped of spaces if parsing succeeded.

psef.tasks¶

This module defines all celery tasks. It is very important that you DO NOT change the way parameters are used or the parameters provided in existing tasks as there may tasks left in the old queue. Instead create a new task and change the mapping of the variables at the bottom of this file.

SPDX-License-Identifier: AGPL-3.0-only

psef.tasks.init_app(app: flask.app.Flask) → None[source]¶

Setup the tasks for psef.

Return type

None

psef.plagiarism¶

This module defines all classes and function needed for the plagiarism checking infrastructure.

The actual providers are located in the psef.plagiarism_providers module.

SPDX-License-Identifier: AGPL-3.0-only

class psef.plagiarism.Option(self, name: str, title: str, description: str, type: psef.plagiarism.OptionTypes, mandatory: bool, possible_options: Optional[Sequence[str]], placeholder: Optional[str] = None) → None[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents a single option for a plagiarism provider.

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the option.

  • title (str) – The title of the option.

  • description (str) – The description of the options.

  • type (OptionTypes) – The type of this option.

  • mandatory (bool) – If this is True the plagiarism provider can only function when this option is supplied.

  • possible_options (Optional[Sequence[str]]) – Possible values for this option. This value has to be a non empty sequence if the type is multiselect or singleselect.

description: str¶
mandatory: bool¶
name: str¶
placeholder: Optional[str] = None¶
possible_options: t.Optional[t.Sequence[str]]¶
title: str¶
type: OptionTypes¶
class psef.plagiarism.OptionTypes(value)[source]¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

Describes the type of the option

Parameters

  • multiselect – An option that should be one or more values from the possible_options list. It should be passed back as an array of values, not indices!.

  • singleselect – The same as multiselect, only it can be one value and it should be passed back as that value, not an array.

  • numbervalue – An option that should be a number.

  • strvalue – An option that should be a string.

multiselect: int = 1¶
numbervalue: int = 3¶
singleselect: int = 2¶
strvalue: int = 4¶
class psef.plagiarism.PlagiarismProvider[source]¶

Bases: object

The (abstract) base class every plagiarism provider should inherit from.

The main functionality each implementation should provide are options and mapping those options to a program call (the actual plagiarism checking should be done in an external program). This program is called from a celery task and should produce log on stdout and stderr, and a csv file that should follow the format expected by process_output_csv(). If the csv needs to be transformed this can be done using PlagiarismProvider.transform_csv() which is called just before the csv file is processed.

abstract static get_options() → Sequence[psef.plagiarism.Option][source]¶

Get all possible options for this provider.

This function needs to be implemented by the provider.

Return type

Sequence[Option]

Returns

A list of possible options for this plagiarism provider.

abstract get_program_call(self) → List[str][source]¶

Get a program call list that runs the checker.

This list is used as the first argument to subprocess.check_output(), with shell=False. It can contain two special entries:

1. '{ restored_dir }': This will be replaced with the location of the files that need to be checked.

2. '{ result_dir }': This will be replaced with the directory where the result csv needs to be placed.

This function needs to be implemented by the provider.

Return type

list[str]

Returns

A list as that can be used with subprocess.check_output().

abstract static get_progress_from_line(prefix: str, line: str) → Optional[Tuple[int, int]][source]¶

Get the progress of the plagiarism provider.

This function is called for every line of output produced by the provider. This should return two values, the first value should be the amount of submissions processed and the second the total amount. These values first indicate that this many submissions have been parsed. When the first value is equal to the second value it means that all submissions have been parsed and that comparing has started.

You should return None if the given line doesn’t contain progress information.

Return type

Optional[tuple[int, int]]

Returns

Two values or None as described above.

abstract property matches_output¶

The path of the csv file that contains the matches in the correct format.

This function needs to be implemented by the provider.

Return type

str

Returns

The path of the result csv relative to the { result_dir }.

set_options(self, values: Union[Dict[str, Union[str, int, float, bool, None, Dict[str, Any], List[Any]]], List[Union[str, int, float, bool, None, Dict[str, Any], List[Any]]], str, int, float, bool, None, Dict[str, Any], List[Any]]) → None[source]¶

Set the options for this plagiarism provider.

Parameters

values (Union[dict[str, Union[str, int, float, bool, None, dict[str, Any], list[Any]]], list[Union[str, int, float, bool, None, dict[str, Any], list[Any]]], str, int, float, bool, None, dict[str, Any], list[Any]]) – The options for this run, this can still include the provider and old_assignments key.

Return type

None

Returns

Nothing.

Raises

APIException – If the values are not the correct format, if mandatory options miss, if an option has an incorrect value or if given value was not recognized.

A boolean indicating if the provider supports base code.

Return type

bool

Returns

True if this provider supports progress detection.

static transform_csv(csvfile: str) → str[source]¶
Transform the csv file outputed by the plagiarism checker to

something that is readable by process_output_csv().

Parameters

csvfile (str) – The location of the old csv file.

Return type

str

Returns

The location of the csv file that can be processed by process_output_csv().

psef.plagiarism.init_app(app: Any) → None[source]¶

Initialize providers for the given flask app.

Param

The flask app to initialize for.

Return type

None

Returns

Nothing

psef.plagiarism.process_output_csv(lookup_map: Dict[str, int], old_submissions: Container[int], file_tree_lookup: Dict[int, psef.files.FileTree[int]], csvfile: str, delimiter: str = ';') → List[psef.models.plagiarism.PlagiarismCase][source]¶

Process the outputted csv file into plagiarism cases with matches.

Each line of the csvfile should have the following items separated by delimiter:

  1. The top level directory of the first submission;

  2. The top level directory of the second submission;

  3. The amount that submission 1 matched with submission 2;

  4. The amount that submission 2 matched with submission 1;

  5. The relative path of first file that matched;

  6. The start position were the match for the first file begins;

  7. The end position were the match for the first file ends;

  8. The relative path of second file that matched;

  9. The start position were the match for the second file begins;

  10. The end position were the match for the second file ends;

Fields 5-10 can occur any number of times, but have to occur at least once.

Parameters

  • lookup_map (dict[str, int]) – A dictionary that should map the name of each toplevel directory to a submission id.

  • old_submissions (Container[int]) – Some sort of set that contains the ids of all submissions that are old. If a match between two of those submissions is found this match in not inserted into the database.

  • file_tree_lookup (dict[int, FileTree[int]]) – A lookup that maps submission ids to their file trees.

  • csvfile (str) – The location of the csv file that follow the above format.

  • delimiter (str) – The delimiter used for this csv file.

Return type

list[PlagiarismCase]

This file contains all permissions used by CodeGrade in a python enum.

Warning

Do not edit this enum as it is automatically generated by “generate_permissions_py.py”.

class psef.permissions.CoursePermission(value)[source]¶

Bases: psef.permissions.BasePermission

The course permissions used by CodeGrade.

Warning

Do not edit this enum as it is automatically generated by “generate_permissions_py.py”.

Variables

  • can_submit_others_work – Users with this permission can submit work to an assignment for other users. This means they can submit work that will have another user as the author.

  • can_submit_own_work – Users with this permission can submit their work to assignments of this course. Usually only students have this permission.

  • can_edit_others_work – Users with this permission can edit files in the submissions of this course. Usually TAs and teachers have this permission, so they can change files in the CodeGra.de filesystem if code doesn’t compile, for example.

  • can_grade_work – Users with this permission can grade submissions.

  • can_see_grade_before_open – Users with this permission can see the grade for a submission before an assignment is set to “done”.

  • can_see_others_work – Users with this permission can see submissions of other users of this course.

  • can_see_assignments – Users with this permission can view the assignments of this course.

  • can_see_hidden_assignments – Users with this permission can view assignments of this course that are set to “hidden”.

  • can_use_linter – Users with this permission can run linters on all submissions of an assignment.

  • can_edit_assignment_info – Users with this permission can update the assignment info such as name, deadline and status.

  • can_assign_graders – Users with this permission can assign a grader to submissions of assignments.

  • can_edit_cgignore – Users with this permission can edit the .cgignore file for an assignment.

  • can_upload_bb_zip – Users with this permission can upload a zip file with submissions in the BlackBoard format.

  • can_edit_course_roles – Users with this permission can assign or remove permissions from course roles and add new course roles.

  • can_edit_course_users – Users with this permission can add users to this course and assign roles to those users.

  • can_create_assignment – Users with this permission can create new assignments for this course.

  • can_upload_after_deadline – Users with this permission can submit their work after the deadline of an assignment.

  • can_see_assignee – Users with this permission can see who is assigned to assess a submission.

  • manage_rubrics – Users with this permission can update the rubrics for the assignments of this course.

  • can_view_own_teacher_files – Users with this permission can view the teacher’s revision of their submitted work.

  • can_see_grade_history – Users with this permission can see the grade history of an assignment.

  • can_delete_submission – Users with this permission can delete submissions.

  • can_update_grader_status – Users with this permission can change the status of graders for this course, whether they are done grading their assigned submissions or not.

  • can_update_course_notifications – Users with this permission can change the all notifications that are configured for this course. This includes when to send them and who to send them to.

  • can_edit_maximum_grade – Users with this permission can edit the maximum grade possible, and therefore also determine if getting a ‘bonus’ for an assignment is also possible.

  • can_view_plagiarism – Users with this permission can view the summary of a plagiarism check and see details of a plagiarism case. To view a plagiarism case between this and another course, the user must also have either this permission, or both “See assignments” and “See other’s work” in the other course.

  • can_manage_plagiarism – Users with this permission can add and delete plagiarism runs.

  • can_list_course_users – Users with this permission can see all users of this course including the name of their role.

  • can_edit_own_groups – Users with this permission can edit groups they are in. This means they can join groups, add users to groups they are in and change the name of groups they are in. They cannot remove users from groups they are in, except for themselves.

  • can_edit_others_groups – Users with this permission can edit groups they are not in, they can add users, remove users and rename all groups. Users with this permission can also edit groups they are in.

  • can_edit_groups_after_submission – Users with this permission can edit groups which handed in a submission. Users with this permission cannot automatically edit groups, they also need either “Edit own groups” or “Edit others groups”.

  • can_view_others_groups – Users with this permission can view groups they are not in, and the members of these groups.

  • can_edit_group_assignment – Users with this permission can change an assignment into a group assignment, and change the minimum and maximum required group size.

  • can_edit_group_set – Users with this permissions can create, delete and edit group sets.

  • can_create_groups – Users with this permission can create new groups in group assignments.

  • can_view_course_snippets – Users with this permission can see the snippets of this course, and use them while writing feedback.

  • can_manage_course_snippets – Users with this permission can create, edit, and delete snippets for this course.

  • can_view_hidden_fixtures – Users with this permission can view hidden autotest fixtures.

  • can_run_autotest – Users with this permission can start AutoTest runs

  • can_delete_autotest_run – Users with this permission can delete AutoTest runs

  • can_edit_autotest – Users with this permission can create, delete, edit the fixtures of, setup scripts of, and test sets of an AutoTest

  • can_view_hidden_autotest_steps – Users with this permission can view hidden AutoTest steps if they have the permission to view the summary of this step

  • can_view_autotest_before_done – Users with this permission can view AutoTest, such as sets, before the state of the assignment is “Open”

  • can_view_autotest_step_details – Users with this permission are allowed to see the details of non hidden AutoTest steps

  • can_view_autotest_fixture – Users with this permission are allowed to see non hidden AutoTest fixtures

  • can_view_autotest_output_files_before_done – Users with this permission can view output files created during an AutoTest before the assignment state is “done”

  • can_delete_assignments – Users with this permission can delete assignments within this course.

  • can_override_submission_limiting – Users with this permission can create new submissions, even if the maximum amount of submissions has been reacher, or if a cool-off period is in effect.

  • can_see_linter_feedback_before_done – Users with this permission can see the output of linters before an assignment is set to “done”

  • can_see_user_feedback_before_done – Users with this permission can see feedback before an assignment is set to “done”

  • can_view_analytics – Users with this permission can view the analytics dashboard of an assignment.

  • can_edit_others_comments – Users with this permission can edit inline comments left by other users

  • can_add_own_inline_comments – Users with this permission can add and reply to inline comments on submissions they are the author of

  • can_view_others_comment_edits – Users with this permission may see the edit history of comments placed by others

  • can_view_feedback_author – Users with this permission can view the author of inline and general feedback

  • can_email_students – Users with this permission can email students using the contact student button.

  • can_view_inline_feedback_before_approved – Users with this permission can view unapproved inline comments, comments that need approval include peer feedback comments. Users still need to have the permission to see the feedback, so this permission alone is not enough to see peer feedback.

  • can_approve_inline_comments – Users with this permission can approve inline comments, comments that need approval include peer feedback comments.

  • can_edit_peer_feedback_settings – Users with this permission can edit the peer feedback status of an assignment.

can_add_own_inline_comments = _PermissionValue(item=52, default_value=False)¶

class psef.permissions.GlobalPermission(value)[source]¶

Bases: psef.permissions.BasePermission

The global permissions used by CodeGrade.

Warning

Do not edit this enum as it is automatically generated by “generate_permissions_py.py”.

Variables

  • can_add_users – Users with this permission can add other users to the website.

  • can_use_snippets – Users with this permission can use the snippets feature on the website.

  • can_edit_own_info – Users with this permission can edit their own personal information.

  • can_edit_own_password – Users with this permission can edit their own password.

  • can_create_courses – Users with this permission can create new courses.

  • can_manage_site_users – Users with this permission can change the global permissions for other users on the site.

  • can_search_users – Users with this permission can search for users on the side, this means they can see all other users on the site.

  • can_impersonate_users – Users with this permission can impersonate users, i.e. they can login as other users.

  • can_manage_lti_providers – Users with this permission can edit and list existing, and create new LTI providers.

  • can_manage_sso_providers – Users with this permission can connect new SSO Identity Providers.

can_add_users = _PermissionValue(item=0, default_value=False)¶

can_edit_own_info = _PermissionValue(item=2, default_value=True)¶
can_edit_own_password = _PermissionValue(item=3, default_value=True)¶

psef.plagiarism_providers¶

This module contains all plagiarism providers.

A plagiarism provider is a class that extends and implements the missing functions from psef.plagiarism.PlagiarismProvider.

SPDX-License-Identifier: AGPL-3.0-only

psef.plagiarism_providers.init_app(_: object) → None[source]¶
Return type

None

psef.auto_test¶

This module contains all functionality needed to do an actual AutoTest run.

SPDX-License-Identifier: AGPL-3.0-only

The deadline of the assignment.

class psef.auto_test.AutoTestContainer(self, name: str, config: psef.FlaskConfig, cont: Optional[lxc.Container] = None) → None[source]¶

Bases: object

This class represents a lxc container that will be used in an AutoTest.

This container might be started, not started. To execute commands you should use the StartedContainer class which can be obtained using the AutoTestContainer.started_container() method.

clone(self, *, new_name: str = '') → psef.auto_test.AutoTestContainer[source]¶

Parameters

AutoTestContainer

A clone of this container with the provided name.

  • url (str) – The url from which to download the files.

  • dst (str) – The path in the container where to store the file.

  • from_home (bool) – Should the dst path be interpreted as a relative path from the home directory of the codegrade user.

Bases: Exception

This exception is raised when a command takes too much time.

class psef.auto_test.CpuCores(self, manager: psef.auto_test._Manager, number_of_cores: Optional[int] = None) → None[source]¶

Bases: object

This class contains a reservation system for cpu cores.

With this class you can make sure only one of the containers is using specific core at any specific moment. This also works across multiple processes.

class Core(self, core_number: int, cores: psef.auto_test.CpuCores) → None[source]¶

Bases: object

A class representing the currently reserved core.

Note

This class is mutable, so get_core_number() might change.

get_core_number(self) → int[source]¶

Get the number of the core that is reserved.

Return type

int

yield_core(self) → bool[source]¶

Yield the current core.

Warning

The core that is reserved might be changed after this call. So make sure that you actually lock the container to this core after the call.

Return type

bool

reserved_core(self) → Generator[psef.auto_test.CpuCores.Core, None, None][source]¶

Reserve a core for the duration of the with block.

Return type

Generator[Core, None, None]

yield_core(self, core_number: int) → int[source]¶

Yield the given core.

Return type

int

Returns

The number of the newly reserved core.

class psef.auto_test.ExecuteOptions(self, update_test_result: psef.auto_test.UpdateResultFunction, test_instructions: psef.auto_test.StepInstructions, achieved_percentage: float, yield_core: psef.auto_test.YieldCoreCallback) → None[source]¶

Bases: object

Options passed to the steps when executing them.

Variables

  • update_test_result – A function that can be used to update the step result.

  • test_instructions – The instructions for how to execute this step.

  • achieved_percentage – The percentage of points achieved at this point for the current suite.

  • yield_core – A callback that shuts the container down, yields the reserved core and requests a new one, and starts the container back up.

Bases: Exception

class psef.auto_test.LockableValue(self, initial_value: T) → None[source]¶

Bases: typing.Generic

This class essentially contains a lock and a value.

It forces you to acquire the lock before you can get or set the value.

get(self) → T[source]¶

Get the internal value.

Return type

T

set(self, value: T) → None[source]¶

Set the internal value.

Return type

None

class psef.auto_test.OutputTail(self, data: Sequence[int], overflowed: bool) → None[source]¶

Bases: object

This class represents the tail of an output stream.

If overflowed is True there was even more data captured, but this was thrown away.

class psef.auto_test.RunnerInstructions(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: dict

Instructions for a complete auto test run.

Variables

  • runner_id – The id of this runner.

  • run_id – The id of this auto test run.

  • auto_test_id – The id of this AutoTest configuration.

  • result_ids – The ids of the results this runner should produce. These can be seen as submissions. (Deprecated, use student_infos instead)

  • student_ids – The ids of the user corresponding to the result with id at the same index in the result_ids list. (Deprecated, use student_infos instead)

  • assignment_info – Assignment information made available to AutoTest steps.

  • student_infos – List of information associated to each result.

  • sets – The sets that this AutoTest configuration contain.

  • setup_script – The setup script that should be run for each student.

  • run_setup_script – The setup script that should be run once.

  • heartbeat_interval – The interval in seconds to send heartbeats in.

  • fixtures – A list of tuples where the first item is the name of the fixture and the second item is its id.

class psef.auto_test.SetInstructions(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: dict

Instructions for a single AutoTest set.

Variables

  • id – The id of this set.

  • suites – The suites of this set.

  • stop_points – The minimum amount of points that we should have to be able to continue running sets.

class psef.auto_test.StartedContainer(self, container: lxc.Container, name: str, config: psef.FlaskConfig) → None[source]¶

Bases: object

This class represents a started lxc container. It can be used to execute commands.

as_snapshot(self, disable_network: bool = False) → Generator[psef.auto_test.StartedContainer, None, None][source]¶

Create a snapshot of the running container.

Warning

The state of the network of the container will be altered by doing this. To also restore the network use StartedContainer.enable_network() and StartedContainer.disable_network().

Return type

Generator[StartedContainer, None, None]

Return type

None

Disable the network of this container.

Return type

None

enable_network(self) → None[source]¶

Enable the network of this container.

Return type

None

extra_env(self, extra_env: Mapping[str, str]) → Iterator[source]¶

Temporarily set extra environment variables in all processes that run in this container.

Supports nesting. Variables defined in the inner context manager take precedence over variables defined in the outer one.

Parameters

extra_env (Mapping[str, str]) – The extra environment variables to set. This is a mapping from variable name to value.

Return type

Iterator[T_co]

property fixtures_dir¶

The directory where the fixtures are located.

Return type

str

move_fixtures_dir(self, new_dir: str) → None[source]¶

Move the fixtures directory to the given new directory.

Parameters

new_dir (str) – The new directory where the fixtures should be located. This directory will be created within FIXTURES_ROOT.

Return type

None

Returns

Nothing

property output_dir¶

Get the output dir for this running container.

For now this is a global variable, but this might change in a future version.

Return type

str

run_command(self, cmd: List[str], stdout: Union[Callable[[bytes], None], None, str] = None, stderr: Optional[Callable[[bytes], None]] = None, stdin: Optional[bytes] = None, user: Optional[str] = None, check: bool = True, retry_amount: int = 1) → int[source]¶

Run a command in this started container.

Parameters

  • cmd (list[str]) – The command argument list that should be run.

  • stdout (Union[Callable[[bytes], None], None, str]) – A callback that will be called for when we recieve output on stdout. This might not contain full lines, or it might contain multiple lines. If passed a string this is interpreted as a filename, where stdout is redirected to.

  • stderr (Optional[Callable[[bytes], None]]) – Same as stdout but for output to stderr, only the file option is not supported.

  • stdin (Optional[bytes]) – The stdin that should be provided to the container.

  • user (Optional[str]) – The user that should run the command. If not provided the command will be executed by the root user.

  • check (bool) – If true and exception will be raised when the exit code of the command is not 0.

  • retry_amount (int) – The amount of times the command will be retried when the exit code is not 0. This option has to be 1 if check is False.

Return type

int

Returns

The exit code of the command.

run_student_command(self, cmd: str, timeout: float, stdin: Union[None, bytes] = None, *, cwd: str = None, keep_stdout_tail: bool = False) → psef.auto_test.StudentCommandResult[source]¶

Run a command provided by the student or teacher.

The main difference between this function and StartedContainer.run_command() is that the command here is a string and it will be executed by a shell.

Parameters

  • cmd (str) – The command that should be executed.

  • timeout (float) – The maximum amount of time the command may take in seconds.

  • stdin (Optional[bytes]) – The stdin that should be provided to the command.

  • cwd (Optional[str]) – The location in which the command should be executed.

Return type

StudentCommandResult

Returns

A tuple of four items, which are respectively the exit code of the command, the produced stdout, the produced stderr and the time taken by the command.

set_cgroup_item(self, key: str, value: str) → None[source]¶

Set a cgroup option in the given container.

Parameters

  • key (str) – The cgroup key to be set.

  • value (str) – The value to set.

Raises

StopRunningTestsException – When the value could not be set successfully.

Return type

None

stopped_container(self) → Generator[psef.auto_test.AutoTestContainer, None, None][source]¶

Temporarily stop the container.

The container will be stopped for the body of the with block.

Return type

Generator[AutoTestContainer, None, None]

class psef.auto_test.StepInstructions(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: dict

Instructions on how to run a single AutoTest step.

Variables

  • id – The id of the step.

  • weight – The amount of points you can achieve with this step.

  • test_type_name – The type of step this is.

  • data – The data of this step, this contains stuff like which command to run and what output to expect.

  • command_time_limit – What is the maximum amount of time a command may run in this step.

psef.auto_test.start_polling(config: psef.FlaskConfig) → None[source]¶

Start polling the configured CodeGrade instances.

Parameters

  • config – The config of this AutoTest runner. This also determines what servers will be polled.

  • repeat – Should we repeat the polling after running a single test.

Module contents¶

This module implements the provider for the JPlag plagiarism checker.

This provider only works with the codegrade fork of JPlag as other versions do not output the needed csv file.

SPDX-License-Identifier: AGPL-3.0-only

class psef.plagiarism_providers.jplag.JPlag(self) → None[source]¶

Bases: psef.plagiarism.PlagiarismProvider

This class implements the JPlag plagiarism provider.

static get_options() → Sequence[psef.plagiarism.Option][source]¶

Get all possible options for JPlag.

Return type

Sequence[Option]

Returns

The possible options.

get_program_call(self) → List[str][source]¶

Get the program call for JPlag.

Return type

list[str]

Returns

A list as that can be used with subprocess.check_output() to run JPlag.

static get_progress_from_line(prefix: str, line: str) → Optional[Tuple[int, int]][source]¶

Get the progress of the plagiarism provider.

This function is called for every line of output produced by the provider. This should return two values, the first value should be the amount of submissions processed and the second the total amount. These values first indicate that this many submissions have been parsed. When the first value is equal to the second value it means that all submissions have been parsed and that comparing has started.

You should return None if the given line doesn’t contain progress information.

Return type

Optional[tuple[int, int]]

Returns

Two values or None as described above.

property matches_output¶

The path were the result csv is placed.

Return type

str

Returns

The specified path

static supports_progress() → bool[source]¶

Does this provider support showing progress to the user.

Return type

bool

Returns

True if this provider supports progress detection.
